div1.sense: to make burnt-offerings, Aesch.

div1.head: θυοσκόος
div1.sense: the sacrificing priest, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: θύος
div1.sense: a sacrifice, offering, Hom., etc.

div1.head: θυόω
div1.sense: to fill with sweet smells: perf. pass. part., ἔλαιον τεθυωμένον fragrant oil. Il.

div1.head: θύραζε
div1.sense: properly θύρασ-δε, out to the door, out of the door, Lat. foras, Hom.
generally, out, Hom.; θ. ἐξιέναι to go out of the ship, Il.:—so in Attic, ἐκφέρειν θ., ἐξέλκειν τινὰ θ. Ar.; οἱ θ. those outside, Ar.
c. gen., ἁλὸς θ. out of the sea, Od.; θ. τῶν νόμων, like ἔξω, Eur.

div1.head: θύραθεν
div1.sense: adv. from outside the door, from without, Eur.
outside the door, outside, θύρηθʼ ἔα was out of the sea, Od.:— οἱ θ. aliens, the enemy, Aesch.

div1.head: θυραῖος
div1.sense: at the door or just outside the door, Aesch., Soph.; θ. οἰχνεῖν to go to the door, go out, Soph.; θ. πόλεμος, opp. to civil war, Aesch.
absent, abroad, Aesch.; from abroad, Eur.; ἄνδρες θυρ. strangers, other men, Eur.; θυραῖα φρονήματʼ the thoughts of strangers, Eur.
= ἀλλότριος, Lat. alienus, ὄλβος θ. the luck of other men, Aesch.; πῆμα Eur.

div1.head: θύρα
div1.sense: a door, Hom., mostly in pl. double or folding doors, in full δικλίδες θύραι Od.: θύρην ἐπιτιθέναι, to put to the door, opp. to ἀνακλίνειν, Il.; so, τὴν θ. προστιθέναι Hdt.; ἐπισπάσαι Xen.; θύραν κόπτειν, πατάσσειν, κρούειν, Lat. januam pulsare, to knock, rap at the door, Ar., Plat.; metaph., ἐπὶ ταῖς θύραις at the door, i. e. close at hand, Xen.

from the Eastern custom of receiving petitions at the gate αἱ τοῦ βασιλέως θύραι became a phrase, βασιλέως θύραις παιδεύονται are educated at court, Xen.; αἱ ἐπὶ τὰς θύρας φοιτήσεις dangling after the court, Xen.
proverb., γλώσσῃ θύραι οὐκ ἐπίκεινται (cf. ἀθυρόστομος) Theogn.; ἐπὶ θύραις τὴν ὑδρίαν to break the pitcher at the very door, = "thereʼs many a slip ʼtwixt cup and lip," Arist.
the door of a carriage, Xen.
θύρη καταπακτή a trap-door, Hdt.
a frame of planks, a raft, φραξάμενοι τὴν ἀκρόπολιν θύρῃσί τε καὶ ξύλοις with planks and logs, Hdt.
generally, an entrance, as to a grotto, Od.

div1.head: θύρασι
div1.sense: at the door, outside, without, Lat. foris, Ar.
out of doors, abroad, Eur.

div1.head: θυραυλέω
div1.sense: to live in the open air, to camp out, Xen., etc.: in war, to keep the field, Arist.

div1.head: θυραυλία
div1.sense: a living out of doors, camping out, Luc.

div1.head: θύραυλος
div1.sense: living out of doors, Hesych.

div1.head: θυρέασπις
div1.sense: a large shield, Anth.; cf. θυρεός II.

div1.head: θυρεός
div1.sense: a stone put against a door to keep it shut, a door-stone, Od.
a large oblong shield (like a door), opp. to ἀσπίς (the round shield), as Lat. scutum to clipeus, ap. Plut.

div1.head: θυρεοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing a shield, Plut.

div1.head: θύρετρα
div1.sense: a door, Hom., etc.

div1.head: θύρηφι
div1.etym: Epic dat. of θύρα, used as adv.
div1.sense: outside, Od., Hes.

div1.head: θύριον
div1.sense: a little door, wicket, Ar.

div1.head: θυρίς
div1.sense: a window, Plat.

div1.head: θυροκοπέω
div1.sense: to knock at the door, break it open, Ar.

div1.head: θυροκόπος
div1.sense: knocking at the door, begging, Aesch.

div1.head: θυρόω
div1.sense: to furnish with doors, shut close, Ar.: metaph. to close as with a door, βλεφάροις θυρῶσαι τὴν ὄψιν Xen.

div1.head: θυρσομανής
div1.sense: he who raves with the thyrsus, Eur.

div1.head: θύρσος
div1.sense: the thyrsus or Bacchic wand, being a wand wreathed in ivy and vineleaves with a pine-cone at the top, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: θυρσοφορέω
div1.sense: to assemble or regulate with the thyrsus, Eur.

div1.head: θυρσοφόρος
div1.sense: thyrsus-bearing, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: θυρσοχαρής
div1.sense: delighting in the thyrsus, Anth.

div1.head: θύρωμα
div1.sense: usu. pl., a room with doors to it, a chamber, Hdt.
a door with posts and frame, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: θυρών
div1.sense: the part outside the door, a hall, antechamber, Lat. vestibulum, Soph.

div1.head: θυρωρέω
div1.sense: to be a door-keeper, Luc.

div1.head: θυρωρός
div1.sense: a door-keeper, porter, Lat. janitor, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: θυρωτός
div1.sense: with a door or aperture, Babr.

div1.head: θυσανόεις
div1.sense: tasseled, fringed, of the aegis, Il.

div1.head: θύσανος
div1.sense: a tassel, in pl. tassels, fringe, Hdt.; of the tufts of the golden fleece, Pind.

div1.head: θύσθλα
div1.sense: the implements of Bacchus, the thyrsi and torches of the Bacchantes, Il.

div1.head: θυσιάζω
div1.sense: to sacrifice, Lys..

div1.head: θυσία
div1.sense: an offering or mode of offering, Hdt.
in pl. offerings, sacrifices, sacred rites, Batr., Hdt., Attic; θυσίῃσι (Ionic dat. pl.) ἱλάσκεσθαι τὸν θεόν Hdt.; θυσίας ἕρδειν, ἐπιτελέειν, ἀνάγειν Hdt.; of the gods, θυσίαν δέχεσθαι Aesch.
a festival, at which sacrifices were offered, Plat.
the victim or offering itself, Luc.

div1.head: θυσιαστήριον
div1.sense: an altar, NTest.

div1.head: θύσιμος
div1.sense: fit for sacrifice, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: θυστάς
div1.sense: sacrificial, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: θυτεῖον
div1.sense: a place for sacrificing, Aeschin.

div1.head: θυτέος
div1.sense: one must sacrifice, Ar.

div1.head: θυτήρ
div1.sense: a sacrificer, slayer, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: θυτικός
div1.sense: of or for sacrifice, Luc.

div1.head: θύω
div1.sense: Act. to offer part of a meal to the gods, Hom. (who used the word only in the sense of offering or burning, never = σφάξαι, to slaughter for sacrifice); θ. πέλανον, δεῖπνα Aesch.; κριθάς, πυρούς Ar.
to sacrifice, i. e. by slaying a victim, τῶι ἡλίωι θ. ἵππους Hdt.; θ. αὑτοῦ παῖδα Aesch.; ἱερεῖα Thuc.:—also simply, to slaughter, slay, Hdt.:—Pass., τὰ τεθυμένα the flesh of the victim, Xen.
absol. to sacrifice, offer sacrifices, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
to celebrate with offerings or sacrifices, c. acc., Hdt., Xen.
c. dupl. acc., εὐαγγέλια θ. ἑκατὸν βοῦς το sacrifice a hundred oxen for the good news, Ar.

Mid. to cause to be offered, to have a victim slain, and so to take the auspices, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—rarely c. inf., θύομαι ἰέναι I consult the auspices about going, to know whether I may go or not, Xen.; so, θύεσθαι ἐπʼ ἐξόδωι Xen.:—metaph. to tear in pieces, Aesch.

div1.head: θύω
div1.sense: to rush on or along, of a rushing wind, Od.; of a swollen river, Il.; of the sea, Od.; δάπεδον αἵματι θῦεν the ground boiled with blood, Od.:—generally, to storm, rage, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: θυώδης
div1.sense: smelling of incense, sweet-smelling, Od., Eur.

div1.head: θυώδης
div1.sense: smelling of incense, sweet-smelling, Od., Eur.

div1.head: θύωμα
div1.sense: that which is burnt as incense; in pl. spices, Hdt.

div1.head: θωή
div1.sense: a penalty, Hom.

div1.head: θῶμιγξ
div1.sense: a cord, string, Hdt.: a bow-string, Aesch.

div1.head: θωμός
div1.sense: a heap, Aesch.

div1.head: θωπεία
div1.sense: flattery, adulation, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: θώπευμα
div1.sense: a piece of flattery, Ar.; pl. caresses, Eur.

div1.head: θωπευμάτια
div1.sense: bits of flattery, Ar.

div1.head: θωπεύω
div1.sense: to flatter, fawn on, cajole, wheedle, Lat. adulari, Soph., Eur., etc.; σὺ ταῦτα θώπευʼ be it thine to flatter thus, Soph.:— to caress or pat a horse, Xen.

div1.head: θωρακεῖον
div1.sense: a breast-work, Aesch.

div1.head: θωρακίζω
div1.sense: to arm with a breastplate or corslet, Xen.:—Mid. to put on oneʼs breastplate, Xen.: —Pass., θωρακισθείς with oneʼs breastplate on, Xen.; οἱ τεθωρακισμένοι cuirassiers, Thuc., Xen.
generally, to cover with defensive armour, ἐθωράκισε πλὴν τῶν ὀφθαλμῶν Xen.

div1.head: θωρακοποιός
div1.sense: making breastplates, Xen.

div1.head: θωρακοπώλης
div1.sense: a dealer in breastplates, Ar.

div1.head: θωρακοφόρος
div1.sense: wearing a breastplate, a cuirassier, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: θώραξ
div1.sense: a breastplate, cuirass, corslet, Lat. lorica, Il.:— the breast and back pieces which composed it were called γύαλα, which were fastened by clasps (ὀχεῖς) on both sides.
the part covered by the breastplate, the trunk, Eur., Plat.
the breastwork of a wall, the outer wall, Hdt.

div1.head: θωρηκτής
div1.sense: armed with breastplate, Il.

div1.head: θωρήσσω
div1.sense: = θωρακίζω, to arm with breastplate: and, generally, to arm, get men under arms, Il.

Mid. and Pass., θωρήσσομαι, fut. ξομαι: aor1 ἐθωρήχθην:— to arm oneself, put oneʼs harness on, Hom.; τεύχεʼ ἐνείκω θωρηχθῆναι I will bring you arms to arm yourselves withal, Od.; πρὸς τοὺς πολεμίους θωρήξομαι Ar.
to make drunk, to intoxicate, Theogn.:— Mid. to drink unmixed wine, to get drunk, Theogn.

div1.head: θώς
div1.sense: the jackal, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: θωϋκτήρ
div1.sense: a barker, roarer, crier, Anth.

div1.head: θωΰσσω
div1.sense: make a noise, of a gnat, to buzz, Aesch.; of men, to cry aloud, shout out, Trag.
c. acc. pers. to call on, call, Soph.; also c. dat., θ. κυσί to shout to dogs, Eur.

div1.head: θώψ
div1.sense: a flatterer, fawner, false friend, Hdt.:—as adj., θῶπες λόγοι fawning speeches, Plat.
